VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedPolygon

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedPolygon (const AVMii *blob_ii, VLIB_blobAnalysis_point *blobBoundary, VLIB_blobAnalysis_point *polygonBoundary, int32_t *numPolygonPt)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_calcBlobMinEnclosedPolygon ( const AVMii *  blob_ii,
VLIB_blobAnalysis_point *  blobBoundary,
VLIB_blobAnalysis_point *  polygonBoundary,
int32_t *  numPolygonPt 
)

Description:
This function finds the minimal enclosed polygon of a blob. The blob interval image is input to the module. By using the interval image, the boundary pixels are extracted and stored into the blobBoundary buffer. By filtering the boundary pixels, the vertices of minimal enclosed convex polygon are extracted and stored into polygonBoundary buffer. The number of vertices in the polygonBoundary array is written to pointer numPolygonPt
Parameters:
[in] blob_ii The pointer to the interval image of the blob (AVMii)
[in] blobBoundary The buffer pointer to store output boundary pixels's (x,y) coordinate of the blob. The application must allocate enough buffer to store all the boundary pixels of the blob. During blob list creation, function VLIB_createBlobList returns the maximal height and width of all the blobs in the image. These parameters can be used to calculate the maximal buffer buffers needed. (VLIB_blobAnalysis_point)
[out] polygonBoundary The buffer pointer to store output vertex's (x,y) coordinate of the polygon. The application must allocate enough buffer to store all the vertex pixels of the blob. The same buffer size as for blobBoundary is enough. (VLIB_blobAnalysis_point)
[out] numPolygonPt The pointer to return the number of vertices of the polygon (Q32.0)
Assumptions:
  • All I/O buffers are assumed to be not aliased.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is fully interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C66 floating-point processors
Performance Notes:
NA
